title.narrative: Land Allocation for Social and Economic Development

description.narrative: The development objective of the pilot program is to improve the process for identification and use of state lands transferred to eligible, poor and formerly landless or land-poor recipients selected through a transparent and well-targeted process as indicated by:(a) the adoption rates of improved land management and agricultural production systems in SLC sub-projects;(b) proportion of land recipients which meet poverty criteria and were landless or land-poor prior to project interventions;(c) the effective implementation of dispute resolution procedures under the project, related to challenges to the land recipient selection process.

participating-org.narrative: General Secretariat for Social Land Concession (GSSLC), MLMUPC
National Committee for Sub-National Democratic Development Secretariat (NCDDS), Ministry of Interior

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Section V.5.(a) (ii) | Description :Engage a consulting firm to carry out quantitative impact evaluation withterms of reference satisfactory to IDA | Due Date :30-Sep-2008
Finance Agreement :Section V.5.(a) (iii) | Description :Install accounting software | Due Date :30-Sep-2008
Finance Agreement :Section V.5.(b) (i) | Description :Complete a communications strategy to support public understanding of SLCs |Due Date :31-Dec-2008

title.narrative: Target land area with use or ownership rights recorded as a result of project

comment.narrative: This indicator is being added as a new CSI. It is the same as in the indicator above on #120.
A total of 10,273.13 hectares of land from 7 communes (102.73% of target) have been used or ownership rights recorded as a resultof project.

title.narrative: Technologies demonstrated in the project areas (number)

comment.narrative: This indicator is being added as a new CSI.

A package of agricultural training, support services and advice has been provided to the land recipients to help them plan andmanage their agricultural lands and backyard gardens. To date, a total of 493 courses were provided.

title.narrative: Target popln with use or ownership rights recorded as a result of the project

comment.narrative: This indicator is being added as a new CSI.
End target number (at least 90%). Census in 2008: Average size of household (excluding institutional, homeless, boat andtransient household) has 4.7 in 2008 in rural areas.
A total of 15,226 persons (of which 52% are female) with use or ownership rights recorded as a result of the project.

title.narrative: Broad knowledge of LASED supported SLC approach, procedures and experiences amongst RGC, local authorities, civil society organizations and donors.

comment.narrative: Knowledge and experience of LASED stakeholders have continuously improved specifically the legal, technical and operationalprocedures.

title.narrative: At least 60% of land recipients adopt improved soil management and agricultural production systems.

comment.narrative: 1,723 families occupied their agricultural land received from project. There were 3,547 ha of agricultural land prepared forfarming and 2,234 ha have cultivated with annual and permanent crops.

title.narrative: 100 percent eligible households receive appropriate private settling in support as agreed in SLC plan.

comment.narrative: 100% of installed households in the eight SLC sites have been provided with housing and agricultural packages.

title.narrative: At least 70% of challenges to land recipients selection were reviewed and decision taken through the program dispute resolution mechanism.

comment.narrative: 100% of the 678 complaints received have been reviewed. 35% of them have been addressed/fully resolved while the rest weredismissed. No further complaints have been received.

title.narrative: 100 percent of procurement activities implemented consistent with guidelines.

comment.narrative: 100% of the prior and post procurement reviews have complied with WB Procurement Guidelines.

title.narrative: 10,000 hectares of appropriate state land registered as state private land for SLCs under LASED.

comment.narrative: A total of 10,273.13 hectares of land from 7 communes (103% of target) have been registered as state private land.

title.narrative: At least 3,000 eligible families receive SLCs under LASED.

comment.narrative: A total of 3,148 (104% of target) land recipients have been selected in which 74 families have received residential land, 658families received agriculture land and 2,416 families received both.

title.narrative: 80 percent of public infrastructure and other services provided as elaborated in SLC plan.

comment.narrative: About 86.66% of the planned infrastructure facilities have been completed in the SLC sites. In addition, 90.87% of the plannedservices and training have been extended to project beneficiaries.

title.narrative: At least 90% of land recipients selected matched the selection criteria agreed for those specific SLCs.

comment.narrative: All 3,148 land recipients were selected based on the agreed selection criteria.
Eight SLC plans from the seven communes have been approved by the respective Provincial Land Use Allocation Committees.7 communesapproved at the RP in October 2012.

title.narrative: Women as share of participants in training, workshops and as applicants (head of households or cosignatory).

comment.narrative: Of the 3,148 land recipients, 1,079 (34%) are female-headed households; while 52% (23, 285) of the training participants were women.

title.narrative: Reporting to NCSLC and Bank on time.

comment.narrative: Reports are prepared regularly from sub-national level and then sent to NCDDs and GSSLC for consolidation. Report timeliness hasgenerally improved, but could improve further.

title.narrative: 90 percent of MBPI recipients assessed as effectively carrying out LASED responsibilities.

comment.narrative: The provision of POC ended on June 30, 2013.

title.narrative: SLCs based on land from at least three sources (cancelled economic land concessions, recovered illegally occupied lands, & degradedforest lands) tested, experiences documented and guidelines updated.

comment.narrative: There were two main sources of land for LASED-SLC: (a) 94.5% from degraded forest; and (b) 5.5% from recovered illegally occupiedland. No land has been sourced from economic concessions.

title.narrative: Financial audit confirms implementation consistent with agreed procedures.

comment.narrative: The audit report for Fy13 is expected in second quarter 2014.
